page.title: 09KNOCKNAGAEL STUD FARM
page.content: This is the main farm of a group of farms belonging to the Department of Agriculture and Fisheries (Scotland).The others are Balrobert, Beechwood and Aberchalder. It is a special farm because it sends pedigreed bulls and rams to crofting counties mainly in the{ {WESTERN ISLES}of Scotland, to help the quality of breeding. There are 2 schemes _ the{SUPPLY {BULL SCHEME}and the{SHEEP IMPROVEMENT {SCHEME.}In 1985 there were over 200 bulls and 1500 rams available. We saw Hereford, Aberdeen Angus, Shorthorn and Luing bulls.The rams were Blackface and Cheviot. We saw Shetland cattle which are smaller than ordinary cattle. There was a 4day old calf. It was lovely.
